column5: Yeah for sure. This guy was my buddy's, girlfriends, uncle. He was in the Hells, then he disappeared.
Gotta agree with you...a lot of American beer is weasel whizz. I can drink that stuff all day and never bust anything more then a smile.
Sources, I hear, are hard to find    Figures right when I write this the song "Rocky Top" comes on lol

I prefer Bud or Heineken, and Amber Bach is one of my favorites, but its only in the US  Since I've gone back to college full time and stopped working I've discovered the wonderful world of Old Milwaukee

Reigler Hells Anything German that's not an import.  Ah German Beer, Luke Warm.  A Pilsner takes half an hour to pour, so you have to allow a half hour to order.  Oh Ya, drinking from the Glass boot, gots to watch for that bubble.  Ya the beer man dropping a case off at your house just like the milkman used to do.  And the construction workers taking a breather with a beer in heavy traffic.  The best part is, each town made its own beer and they were all good.  Never did make it to the Monastery where the Monks supposedly made the best beer in the world.  If Im not mistaken I think it was a castle in a town called Monster.  I miss Germany, a great place to live for 4 years.  When I got back it took me several months to get drunk on Canadian Beer as the strong German beer made my system sort of Immune

Guiness or Smithwicks if out on the town  Dab, Stella ,Grolsch ,Boddingtons for lounging around the BBQ  Maclay's if the inlaws are coming over  Just tried Presidents Choice Pilsner and found it pretty good , something about clear bottles , the backyard deck and a cold snow bank that I like .  TB
I'll take a Kilkenny!

I rarely drink anything, but when I drink beer, I buy Steam Whistle and or Grolsh. If I'm just wanting to have some beer around the house, I'll buy Bud simply because it is not filling and doesn't do the nasty things to my system that most beer usually does! Mmmmm SteamWhistle! HH

Yeah, up where my dad lives, Yellowknife, NT, it is close to $60 for a 24. In Quebec City where my mom lives it costs $19.99+tx and deposit, so around $27 for a 24 of Molson or Labatt products when they go on sale AT THE CONVENIENCE STORE!   Doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out who i visit more.
When I am home:  Sam Adams Guinness Becks  When I am visiting Canada: Keiths Sleemans Carlsburg
Heineken, Stella, Creemore, Moosehead.
ummmm beer..my fav's are zywiec(polish) and moosehead.
Could'nt agree with you more....nothing beats a rye and ginger
BLACK AND TANS
Wet beer is the best!!!!!
Favorite, Innis & Gunn, but at $3.25 abottle it is liquid Gold.  Moosehead & Sleemans Draught are my staples
Ginger is good for a hangover. Anything hard and water for mix for me.

As for beer I like my won home brew best. When I buy beer it's usually Canadian. For you dark beer drinkers, I stumbled upon a 24 of Wee Willy Scottish Style beer at the Erin Beer Store. It's made by Lakeport and suprisingly good when drank form a glass.
Canadian  Heineken

For the good shindigs it's either Crown and Ginger or Gibson's Silver and Ginger. When I'm trying to budget it's Budweiser, and if I don't care about price it's Keith's Red Amber.   Oh Ya - Budweiser = Because U Deserve What Every Individual Should Enjoy Regularly. (took a few pops to figure that one out).   Hookset.
RED STRIPE, Corona, Heineken, Coors Light, Moosehead, Sapporo, Asahi, Sleeman's Honey Brown...
Any beer the is wet
Alexander Keith's India Pale Ale.

I got started drinking Export and 50 at parties, people would always seem to scam you out of a Canadian or a Blue, but they would never touch, Ex, 50, or Black label lol I guess it just kinda stuck on me...
Red Cap Molson Ex Black Label
I like Steam Whistle. Stella Artois,

My everyday beer is Lakeport Light in cans. I enjoy most beers but being a Molson drinker for most of my career, I tend to shy away from Blue. A beer that I have the fondest memories of is McEwenâ€™s IPA. Like an angel peeing on your tongue. I used to drink it in of all places, Terre Haute Indiana. $2.00 a bottle, magic!
"6 Schlitz.....or whatever's free" just like my boy Rodney Farva.
1) Richards Red 2) Coors Light 3) Richards White Ale 4) Abinsthe 7.5A% with warmwood,
Grolsh - used to date the brewmasters daughter before I met my wife. Duvel - kicks like a mule had it in Belgium Anything different, I like new experiences
Keiths and Stella and Becks
Grolsh Pop tops Grolsh Tall Cans when on sale for $1.95 per Blue Moon

I like the darker beers in general...just stumbled upon Sleemans Porter which is good.  Love Kilkenny....drink alot of eastern european beers too Zywiec, Lech, and EB from Poland (I'm polish)....Golden Pheasant from czech or Slovak.  In general Euro beers are really nice

I love beer, and drink all different kinds. i never get the same type twice in a row. I'm not a big fan of pilsners, and i find ales can be hit and miss. I prefer beers with flavour, and a little body. I enjoy Micro brewery beers. Wilde Old Ale is one of my all time favourites.  Boddingtons is a favourite for eating with fish. If i'm buying cheep i usually "Tie on a Boh."  Coors light i prefer a little warmer....and in the last year i have really gotten into the habit of drinking all my beer out of a glass and much prefere the taste then out of teh bottle or can.  Next year i'm pretty my room mate and I are going to invest in a beer fridge.  -R-

Now here is a beer drinker. Without a good chill and a lime this beer has serious limitations.  Have to say if I could only drink one beer, day in day out, it would be Pilsner Urquell . No sissy pansyass beer that needs a lime to be notable, there!
Coors Light and Canadian...
24 Boh...$26.70/case in my end of town... Fast travellers.........LCBO $2.10 large cans of Cndn or Bud! When I entertain those I really like..its Stella all the way.
rootbeer
Ther is NO bad beer,,,some are just better than others
I can't believe how many beer snobs there are in here! No wonder there are never any beer pics in your reports! I wouldn't advertise it either!
Mongoose

RICHARDS WHITE   with an orange slice......ahhhhhhhh  If you like lagers but find Ale's have a little to much body, than this is  heaven on earth !!!!!  Try it out... the ORANGE puts a whole new prespective on beer drinking !!
currently Keiths...  Used to drink 50 while in London, ON.
Red Baron is pretty good, as is Maclays and Canadian
All y'all can divvy my share of the Weasel Whizz amongst ya's!  I like the hard stuff!!!

Bullets or Canadian for beer, Jose Cuervo clear for shots and Bacardi clear mixed with lemonade or a Cesar if I want to change it up on a hot day.  Oh and a buddy of mine gave me some shine. All I can say is WOW!! 2 shots of that and a few beer, look out!! Could barely form a sentence the next day, it was like everything was in fast forward and I was a step behind, but no headache.

Ohh well if we're talkin everything homemade shine or the like is the way to go, that or Crown  No headache is good, just have to make sure whoever makes the stuff knows to throw out the bad alcohol, methanol, which will give ya a hangover or worse

Probably been discussed here many times, but I'm just curious as to what everyones favour beer is. Here are my top 3: Guinness Draft(can's are okay, but not bottles) Molson Export Alexander Keith's  Of course, when I'm driving my boat it's water or diet pepsi
Really only one favorite ... Corona.
Guinness Corona in that order
I Like the darks and the bitters always have...  But that being said I also like Pale Ales..  So when I am not drinking a bitter  You will usually see me drinking MacLays.  G
Silver bullets
Busch cans!!! I also like Alberta Premium whiskey but thats another topic i guess haha
My favorite is free beer. Next is Caffrey's (Irish), Bass or Golden Pheasant (Slovakia) which was recommended to me in the summer by a avid beer drinker so I tried it and it was yummy   .
Carling Black Label
1. Moosehead 2. Miller Genuine Draft 3. Maclays (Price driven)  The Bush Man
COLD  ....    im  a canadian , carling guy myself.

corona?????? come on, there's more flavour in bottled water.  it seems for me beer runs in streaks right now i'm on a budwieser streak, before it was canadian,moosehead.........  as for cheapies i like bohemian, find it tatses similar to canadian  this past summer i've started drinking warm beer (started by accident) and have really  enjoyed it, not hot but i've come to rather a bottle straight from the case over an ice cold brew  only beer i've had that i can't take is old milwaukee, nasty
whatever is in your cooler.
MGD  Heinekin  Creemore
Keith's Negra Modelo (for a change) Bock (in spring) It seems the only one available right now is Holsten Festbok. It's okay.

I'm a beer snob fer sure LOL....  I am all over craft brewing and differnt Micro brews. And reeeely lean towards being an Ale guy.  Macauslin's Cream & Pale Ale are great Millstreet's Tankhouse Ale & coffee Porter Kick butt But Grandriver brewery alaways has seasonal Batches like their Pumkin & Spice Draft Lager or their ploughmas Ale for a treat!  But if I'm slum'n Cans of Exports are my drink...tastes great and the Can looks like a coke can from a distance so I rarely get hassled if I smuggle a few down to the beach  Steelbacks brown Bear lager wasn't bad either....and its good for Provincal park camping because of the Plastic bottle they come in.

I'd rather drink beer than... well... anything really.  The Moosonee LCBO has it's limitations... here they are, Canadian, Bud, Blue, Rickards, Sleeman, Kokanee, Keiths, Molson Dry, EX, Corona, Killkenny and Moosehead.  Think I got them all.  Sooooo, they get drank pretty much in this order...  Moosehead, Sleeman or Molson Dry, Blue (cans), Corona and Rickards.  Like JW. Dundees Honey Brown, Connors (on tap), Carlsberg too.
HEINEKEN and heineken

mmmmm beer Creemore, Keiths, Guiness, Killkenny are my faves to have at the pub  usually in my fridge you'll see Labatt 50, John Labatt classic, Muskoka lager and now that the sun is out more often: Brava!
Labatt 50 and Schlitz cans.  Actually...I'm not a beer drinker...I just remember my uncle would leave that nasty stuff at our house after a visit....LOL

mmmm beer!  i make a great bitter (ESB) that everyone seems to enjoy (even those who are used to the bland macro beers)  but other than that, always been a fan of wellington's iron duke, millstreet's tankhouse ale, niagara's best blonde, and tetley's english ale as a seesion beer...oh and fuller's london porter is awesome!  just depends on my mood, my environment, bunch of other factors, haha...  cheers
I buy the cheap stuff at the Beer Store, but when I'm out at a restaurant, I like a Rickards honey brown on tap. Or occasionally a Rickards Red.
coors light  Cheers!
Original Coors, you can only get it in the states.  I always bring a case back whenever I go!
